Reviews.Title: “Thanks for you”
Reviews.Author: Radhi B
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 7 nights in march 2012 in a two bedroom apartment. Size of it was excellent, with dining area in a large open plan area. Well equipped kitchen plus a balcony and nice pool area. I recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wife visiting while I work in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: edchapman59
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 9 nights in February in a 1-bedroom apartment. Size of it was excellent, double bedroom plus dining area in a large open plan area with big sofa, tv and dvd player. Well equipped kitchen plus a balcony and nice pool area. Am staying again in March and would recommend to everyone. Great price as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and out of the way”
Reviews.Author: toontravellers4
Reviews.Content: It took an hour to check in as the recepionist could not find me on their system even though i booked 3 months in advance. Asked to extend my stay by 2 days and was asked to pay my bill striaght away. Paid the bill and was given another bill 2 days later for twice the amount of my original bill even though i asked to pay in full when i checked in . Hotel is out of the way and is not worth the money i paid . Rooms are huge and all appliances are installed in kitchen. Trying to end on a positive !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money with 4/5 star Quality”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: Having lived at the Park Hotel for almost a year 4/5 years back, when I decided to visit Dubai for leisure rather then work, I remembered what an amazing place this was to stay/live. Lovely spacious rooms with huge bed, great little kitchen, living room area and balcony with some lovely views and all done in an Oriental style was all amazing to me. And when I saw the rates for first week in Dec, this was too good to miss! What used to be exclusively executive Apartments for a long term rental/hotel style place to live, now has also entered the short term, which is a great thing. The quality of the rooms and building itself is fantastic and for 1,850 AED for 4 nights in a 1 bed apartment is something that is unheard of in Dubai considering the 4 star (maybe even 5 star) quality of the rooms and hotel. Yes the location is a little off the beaten track but we all know taxis are cheap and they offer free shuttle buses to various Dubai Locations throughout the day. A weeks car hire I got for £67 so location isnt too bad considering what you get! Theres also the 30% off at WAFI Centre which has restaurants and bars which we used. Having returned there Its exactly how I remembered it…in fact hadnt changed one bit…which may be viewed as a bad thing after 4/5 years, but it showed no signs of wear and tear etc. Room was a 1 Bed Appartment (Room 606) and was fantastic! Couldn't fault that. High quality and always clean! Great Kitchen! And nice views of the City even though it was a back facing room despite me requesting a front facing room. Restaurant never used as having a kitchen we made out own breakfast and always went out for dinner. No bar but the Hotel next door (Arabian park Hotel) has one aswell as a restaurant and deli. The pool gets the sun most of the day and towels are supplied and bottle of water handed out too. The pool however in my opinion needs some work done on it as this shows signs of being run down. The tiles around the pool have had there day and need replacing really. Theres also an electric extension lead running from the side of the pool which is obviously powering something under a makeshift cover….surely not safe and the cover with wires and pipes coming out isnt very attractive. Pool isnt heated so can be quite cold in winter months. Staff were helpful, although one security guard was a little over the top when asking my partner who she was when entering the hotel in a rather aggressive manner. My partner told him room number and she asked if there was a problem and he replied "No I just havent seen you before" Bit rude but all other staff were ok for a 4 star Hotel. Over all…great value for money….a great hotel if looking for quality at a low price. Don't be put off with Location either. Pool needs a bit of work but a great little hidden gem for Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places I have stayed in while in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Rethabile M
Reviews.Content: The online bookings manager whose name is Josephine was REALLY rude towards me when I called for some clarification before I stayed at the hotel. That almost made me take my business elswhere. How ever, the rest of the staff at reception was AMAZING!!! very well informed about the touristy things. they were very friendly and warm people. The hotel is good, clean and everything I needed was made available to me immidietly. I was really impressed with the standard of facilities, cleanliness and the service over all. Although the hotel is a little far from everything transport is easily available. You can either walk to the metro or call a taxi, which is inexpensive! The hotel is brand new! I am a very pick person so I wolud advise you to trust my judgement when I say this is one of the best places to stay while in Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & relaxing place - good value”
Reviews.Author: Amal_Jaffar
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. Stayed in the 1-bed apartment with my boyfriend for New Year's weekend (3 nights) and it was a very comfortable and relaxing stay. Check in was easy, and the staff friendly. The apartment was spacious, kitchen fully equipped and the entertainment system working well. Bathroom & toilet were clean and had good a "warm" feeling about them. I loved taking my hot showers and baths in there. We even had a balcony overlooking the small garden downstairs and the city skyline. It was lovely just sitting in there looking at the sky and stars at night. What I like a lot about this hotel is its location. It is only 10-15 minutes away from Sh. Zayed road, Festival City, Wafi and the airport Also, we were given 30% coupons for Wafi restaurants, which saved us a good chunk of money when paying our dinner bill. Hotel food is OK, but don't expect much. It was a quiet stay - although we were on the second floor there was no noise whatsoever. Simply loved it - will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, food average”
Reviews.Author: Buckingtonroo
Reviews.Content: A big room with all facilities made for a comfortable stay during a working trip. The Park is in the middle of an undeveloped parcel of land between two freeways, you can't walk to anywhere so a taxi or the hotel bus is the only way out. The food is average and expensive, a £3 taxi ride gets you to Festival City where there are many shops and restaurants offering better value and choice. The Park hotel is unlicensed; however the adjacent Arabian Park hotel has a bar which was smoky and full of expat divorcees drowning their sorrows. Wifi is only availabel in the lobby - in the room the chargeable internet is accessed via a short LAN cable in the bedroom rather than the living room.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance & luxury meets genuine hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Dukes-UAE
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Park Hotel Apartments was absolutely marvelous with great value for money. The 1 bedroom suite was spotless, extremely well equipped with high-end furniture, fittings and guests amenities. Great outdoor pool, gym and fast internet connectivity! Employees very helpful, delivering a personalized service with attention to detail. I will certainly return soon and may highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: sweetsaadia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel and had an excellent stay in every way. There were five of us and we rented a one bedroom and a studio apartment...the rooms were spacious, clean and fully equipped with all the basic necessities, even the liqiud soap for washing the dishes was provided. The cleaning was done promptly and regularly, the 'ENTIRE' staff was extremely friendly and helpful at all times. Although the hotel was fully booked..it was very peaceful. On various occasions when my kids would go to the pool which they loved as it was very esthetically designed, they had the entire pool to themselves. The location was quite central. as it was close to all the major shopping malls, thus the taxi fares were not so much. The only thing was that at times you had to wait for a taxi for more than five minutes......but we took care of that, for when we were about to step out we would have the reception call us a taxi, so by the time we stepped down our taxi would be waiting for us. The hotel had a good shuttle service aswell and provided a discount a various award winning restaurants. I searched high and low for two months for a good hotel, price and location wise and I think choosing this hotel was an excellent choice. We made our reservations through booking.com for the first time and were extremely pleased as everything worked out better than planned and the rates offered through booking.com are definately cheaper and better than the actual hotel rates. Bottom line is that I would recommend this place to anyone and I for one would definately stay here again. Omar Choudhry

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, poor management.”
Reviews.Author: Martin958
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very smart and clean, and the room was modern and very well presented. All the corridors were clean and the ambiance was quiet and relaxing. The staff on check-in were friendly and nice. Sadly it stops there. Breakfast was quoted to me as being 35 AED a day, but no mention was made that I would have to pay extra for sausages and other such items. The buffet was quite small on its own. I asked for 3 breakfasts, but upon checking out they tried to charge me for 4 breakfasts as it was part of a package I had no idea I had bought. I demanded to pay the 3 I had requested and so the Duty officer said he would charge the poor check in girl for this error. After I offered to pay for her, he refused claiming this would be her punishment. Any normal hotel would apologise and just scrap the 35 AED, then inform the girl better. I felt bad for this and I think this was his way of getting back at me. I tried to bring a nice professional Indian girlfriend I had met in Dubai some months earlier to see my room as I told her it was nice. She came all the way over only to have an over-zealous security guard run up to her demanding ID. It was very rude, and she ended up wanting to leave very shortly after coming as she felt unwelcome. This upset me also. I was told it was hotel policy, but I think it is ignored with certain nationalities. Upon checking out I told the Duty officer my complaint and he was initially concerned but then asked what nationality was she? When I said a local Indian girl he completely changed his attitude and seemed quite indifferent saying it was hotel policy. Since when did race or nationality enter the hotels policy on outside visitors??? I was even more shocked when considering he was of Asian background himself. Really he should never have asked her racial background when considering the hotels policy. This was the same guy who charged the check-in girl for my breakfast! I noticed the maintenance team were quick to respond when the Air conditioning controller display in my room stopped working. The air-conditioning still worked okay, it was just the controller screen that broke. He came with a ladder 5 minutes after the call and told me they would replace the faulty controller the next day. I never saw anyone after that and it was not fixed. I requested an ice-cream desert by room phone at around 10pm one evening. The person sounded reluctant and bored, then I was called back 10 minutes later to be told they didn't have that flavour ice-cream anymore. The gym and pool photos were deceiving. The pool is very pleasant and the staff were nice, but it is far more shallow and short than the photo indicates. I tried a late night swim before 10pm on the first night, but I had to get out quickly as 3 young men were screaming and shouting very loudly like idiots. It was not very relaxing at all and someone should have stopped them. The gym is far less modern than the photos try to present and I didn't bother using it. Fianlly the TV in the room is great except that when you turn it around to face the bed the channel changer doesn't work due to no line of sight. And no return answer to my email on all these problems. Could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, 100% we'll come back very soon”
Reviews.Author: joeylarracas
Reviews.Content: A must try apartment in a quiet location in dubai. Satisfaction guaranteed! Friendly staff and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “the place was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: flexywheng
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday at Park Apartment and it feels like I'm at home. With all the kitchen facilities and the very spacious living and dining room, the food preparation was very successful. The biggest rooms and cleanest of all the hotel apartments I went with. The Intercontinental breakfast is excellent. I love the place so much and would like to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Cari21
Reviews.Content: my first time at staying at this hotel ,it was great lovely and clean crisp in fact .The room was excellent, great bedroom and bathroom with space for a separate living area, with mini kitchen. Food was exceptional.All the staff were always friendly and helpful.I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant: Friendly Staff, Spacious, Close to Most Attractions, Excellent Service & Best Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mxhabib
Reviews.Content: Somerset Jadaf feels like home. The apartments are cozy, with plenty of space, excellent staff and close to key activities and landmarks. We've stayed here a number of times when we would come up to Dubai for the weekend from Saudi Arabia. Somerset Jadaf is situated in a way the it has direct access many of the main highways in Dubai. For example, it is about 5 minutes to Dubai Mall and Burj Khalifa and it's about 5 minutes to Wafi Center and about the same to Festival City. To Jumeirah, it is about 20 minute drive and about a 10 minute drive to DIFC. The one-bed room apartment was spacious. Each apartment has a dining table, a lounge, two bathrooms and a huge kitchen. Each bedroom had its own TV with DVD player, in addition to the flat-screen TV with DVD player in the living room. The kitchen comes with a washing machine, dishwasher, fridge/freezer, coffee maker, kettle, basic kitchen utensils like knives, chopping board, cutlery, toaster, colander, drinking glasses and coffee cups. The two-bedroom apartment had its own laundry room. The swimming pool is of a good-size and is nicely situated. Breakfast was provided in all our stays. It's healthy enough, with a selection of fruits, cereals, breads and two hot items a day which rotate. The staff were always polite, friendly and helpful, and always greeted us warmly when we came "home". Herieaty Khalid, the sales manager, was of a great help throughout our stay; whenever we need help she would not hesitate to give the time and effort. She really made our stay even more pleasant. Somerset Jadaf is my home whenever I visit Dubai, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Somerset to friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: iwannagotherenow
Reviews.Content: Somerset Jadaf feels like home. The apartments there are cosy, with plenty of space. The service was excellent as well. Everyone at the hotel was friendly, right down to the wait staff at the breakfast cafe. By the third morning, the waitress was bringing me my usual cup of tea without me having to ask for one! Their eye for detail is unrivalled! We arrived in the same week they had a residents' night- that aimed at bonding amongst residents. Somerset spared no expense at the food, the entertainment for the night (a pretty good singer, and also a henna artist) for their guests. Even though Jadaf is a pretty new area, it is near the airport (excellent for getting to the airport in case there are traffic jams) and getting around is easy with a taxi. Plus points for it being near the Dubai Mall, and Wafi City (where there was Wafi Gourmet and Paul- yum!). Shuttle service was also available to the Jumeriah Beach Park. Having always been a Somerset guest as best as possible, I would say, go for Somerset, they never fail to impress. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Experience - Very Freindly Staff, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ml1234
Reviews.Content: The service we recieved was brilliant and this was a credit to all the staff at the hotel, this went from the Sales Manager, reception staff, security, including the lady who serviced our apartment. We found all the staff very friendly and always helpful this made our stay so pleasant. We stayed for 10 days in a 2 bedroom apartment which was very spacious with dedicated kitchen and laundry facilities. They have a free shuttle service which operates trips to wafi shopping mall, Jumeirah Beach, Festival City this was handy to get around. There is a large outdoor swimming pool with a waterfall and shallow section for children. Occasionally we found the pool water slighly cold. Breakfast was included and continental style served at the restaurant which varied day to day. as location is not within walking distance to any malls/shops/ main roads we had to ask reception to book taxis for us. We never waited more a few mins for a taxi. We dont have any negative comments about our stay and would definately go back there. It really felt like home and a nice place if you want to get away from the bustle of the city centre but still be a short taxi ride away from most places.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Somerset Jadaf, Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Princezzz
Reviews.Content: *The staff are friendly and helpful. *The shuttle to WAFI is great!!! *Close to the airport and accessible to everywhere *Rooms are lovely and spacious impressive .... value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new rooms - but far from the city”
Reviews.Author: Dogbert
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at Somerset Jadaf in early Nov 2007. Managed to get a discounted rate of 900AED per night under Krisflyer PPS Program (details of promotions can be found on their website). Booking was done over the phone via the Singapore office and confirmations were sent across by email on the same day. Also arranged for airport limousine transfers (100AED each way) via the hotel. After we disembarked and started walking through the Dubai Airport, there were several meet and greet areas with people carrying signboards with guest names. This can be a bit confusing if you have booked for a transfer. We went past two meet and greet groups (who did not have our name) and stepped out of the air-conditioned area and found our hotel representative waiting for us there. It took about 10 minutes for our limousine to arrive as it was apparently stuck in a jam somewhere in the airport carpark. We arrived at the hotel in about 20 minutes and check-in went smoothly. I booked a studio and this was spacious and came with a living area, dining area for two, ironing board, hairdrier, CD player, clock radio, flat screen TV, kitchenette (complete with dishwasher, oven, microwave, toaster, kettle, coffee maker, fridge, pots and pans and crockery). The rooms are nice and new as the hotel only opened a year ago. There was also a complimentary welcome basket in the room which was a nice touch. This consisted of 2 packets of biscuits, instant noodles, milk, cornflakes, some dates and chocolates. Good if you arrive in the middle of the night and want something to eat. ). Mineral water, some soft drinks, coffee and tea sachets are also included. The hotel has a coffee house (called Majalis Café) which looked quite deserted when we arrived that evening (ie. 8pm). I think most guests venture out of the hotel for their meals. However, a complimentary continental breakfast is served there daily and you get a good selection of bread, baked beans, mushrooms, hard boiled eggs, cold cuts, cheese, cornflakes, fresh and dried fruit. If you ask for eggs to order, that will cost extra. You can also order room service from the Majalis Café and they have a menu in your room. The menu offered quite a wide international selection. There is a complimentary shuttle service available to the airport, Jumeirah Beach and Wafi City several times a day. The hotel reception staff were very helpful, always offering to get us a taxi when they saw us at the lobby. My morning wake-up call went without a hitch. The only downside is the hotel is located a bit far from central Dubai. You cannot walk to any place from there so you would be relying on taxis to get around. Even Hyatt hotel complex is about 5 minutes drive away. In the morning, it took us about 20 minutes (25AED) by taxi to get to the DIFC. In the evening, it took about 1 hour to get from the Emirates Mall back to the hotel (because there was a road accident which slowed traffic down to a crawl). This hotel would be suitable for families and people who are on long-stay arrangements, and the distance from town isn’t that much of an issue since taxis are quite cheap in Dubai. It is also fairly near the airport (about 20 minutes’ drive).

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Oud Metha Road, Adaf Area, Dubai 122161, United Arab Emirates
